intro: Tripodanthus, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plants typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often with smooth, greyish bark. Their flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are borne in clusters, adding ornamental value to the landscape. Tripodanthus species are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making them resilient to drought conditions.
